meanings.definition: A structure of piles driven into the ground to support a building or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew worked hard on the piling for the new bridge.
meanings.sent2: The tall building stood strong thanks to the sturdy piling beneath it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the piling was a perfect spot for hiding acorns.
meanings.sent4: The piling of wooden stakes resembled a forest of miniature trees supporting the house.
meanings.sent5: The engineer explained how crucial the piling was for the stability of the entire structure.

meanings.definition: A large quantity or number of something.
meanings.sent1: The piling of books on the desk made it hard to find the one she needed.
meanings.sent2: There was a piling of laundry waiting to be folded in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a piling of toys in their room, making it a challenge to walk around.
meanings.sent4: The piling of dishes in the sink seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: She was surprised by the piling of gifts waiting for her on her birthday.
